instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stuck on Apple logo with  trackpad flex. Replacing the trackpad and tape does not help. Only turns on without trackpad flex in the motherboard - J4800. I did a pram and SMC reset. Please help.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_CUMULUS</SIGNAL> - 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL> 3v
<RESISTOR>R4800</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR> are ok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I can't unless I take out the flex.  I can try without

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
You can't start ASD at all?
Can you access boot menu at least?
Disconnect keyboard, let only trackpad connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I can't run ASD with trackpad flex.
I can't access boot menu.
With the keyboard disconnected MacBook stuck on Apple logo.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Check all resistors related with trackpad connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings on trackpad connector with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Diode mode shows no differences.
Test ASD stuck on CPU test.
Hear a jammed chime during startup with trackpad flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL>, w/ and w/o TP connected.
<RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> is good?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I noticed now that it turns on normally without a battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Then put a known good battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: With a new good battery still the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Can you start in SMC bypass with both charger and battery connected?
The "new" battery was tested in other machine?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
SMC bypass does not help.
The battery is tested and operational.
MacBook with battery loops startup sound. 
Only disconnecting the battery or the trackpad flex helps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: So it turns on with battery, but trackpad disconneted?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Yes or turns on with trackpad, but battery disconneted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I still doubt about battery.
Run ASD in both scenarios...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I tested on 3 different batteries. 
I noticed that <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without battery has 12.56v and with about 11v. - on three different batteries
